verses.text: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When a man shall make a singular vow, the persons \add shall be\add* for the LORD, by thy estimation.
And thy estimation shall be, of the male from twenty years old even to sixty years old, even thy estimation shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
And if it \add shall be\add* a female, then thy estimation shall be thirty shekels.
And if \add it shall be\add* from five years old even to twenty years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male twenty shekels, and for the female ten shekels.

And if \add it shall be\add* from a month old even to five years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy estimation \add shall be\add* three shekels of silver.
And if \add it shall be\add* from sixty years old and above; if a male, then thy estimation shall be fifteen shekels, and for the female ten shekels.
But if he shall be poorer than thy estimation, then he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall value him: according to his ability that vowed shall the priest value him.
And if \add it shall be\add* a beast of which men bring an offering to the LORD, all that \add any man\add* giveth of such to the LORD shall be holy.
He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then it and the exchange of it shall be holy.
And if \add it shall be\add* any unclean beast, of which they do not offer a sacrifice to the LORD, then he shall present the beast before the priest:
And the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad: as thou valuest it, \add who art\add* the priest, so shall it be.
But if he will at all redeem it, then he shall add a fifth \add part\add* of it to thy estimation.
And when a man shall sanctify his house \add to be\add* holy to the LORD, then the priest shall estimate it, whether it is good or bad: as the priest shall estimate it, so shall it stand.
And if he that sanctified it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth \add part\add* of the money of thy estimation to it, and it shall be his.

And if a man shall sanctify to the LORD \add some part\add* of a field of his possession, then thy estimation shall be according to the seed of it: a homer of barley seed \add shall be valued\add* at fifty shekels of silver.
If he shall sanctify his field from the year of jubilee, according to thy estimation it shall stand.

But if he shall sanctify his field after the jubilee, then the priest shall reckon to him the money according to the years that remain, even to the year of the jubilee, and it shall be abated from thy estimation.
And if he that sanctified the field will in any wise redeem it, then he shall add the fifth \add part\add* of the money of thy estimation to it, and it shall be assured to him.
And if he will not redeem the field, or if he shall have sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more.
But the field, when it goeth out in the jubilee, shall be holy to the LORD, as a field devoted: the possession of it shall be the priest's.
And if \add a man\add* shall sanctify to the LORD a field which he hath bought, which \add is\add* not of the fields of his possession;
Then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of thy estimation, \add even\add* to the year of the jubilee, and he shall give thy estimation in that day, \add as\add* a holy thing to the LORD.
In the year of the jubilee, the field shall return to him of whom it was bought, \add even\add* to him to whom the possession of the land \add belonged\add* .
And all thy estimations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shall be the shekel.
Only the firstling of the beasts, which should be the LORD'S firstling, no man shall sanctify it; whether ox, or sheep: it \add is\add* the LORD'S.

And if \add it shall be\add* of an unclean beast, then he shall redeem \add it\add* , according to thy estimation, and shall add to it a fifth \add part\add* of it: or if it shall be not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to thy estimation.

Notwithstanding, no devoted thing that a man shall devote to the LORD of all that he hath, \add both\add* of man and beast, and of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to the LORD.
None devoted, which shall be devoted by men, shall be redeemed: \add but\add* shall surely be put to death.
And all the tithe of the land, \add whether\add* of the seed of the land, \add or\add* of the fruit of the tree, \add is\add* the LORD'S: \add it is\add* holy to the LORD.
And if a man will at all redeem \add aught\add* of his tithes, he shall add to it the fifth \add part\add* of it.
And concerning the tithe of the herd, or of the flock, \add even\add* of whatever passeth under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to the LORD.
He shall not search whether it is good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he shall change it at all, then both it and the change of it shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.
These \add are\add* the commandments which the LORD commanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai.
